00034 #ifndef __CONTIKI_CONF_H__
00035 #define __CONTIKI_CONF_H__

00040 #define CC_CONF_REGISTER_ARGS          1
00041 #define CC_CONF_FUNCTION_POINTER_ARGS  1

00043 #define CC_CONF_VA_ARGS                1

00045 #define CCIF
00046 #define CLIF

00048 typedef uint8_t   u8_t;
00049 typedef uint16_t u16_t;
00050 typedef uint32_t u32_t;
00051 typedef  int32_t s32_t;
00052 typedef unsigned short uip_stats_t;
00053 
00054 #if UIP_CONF_IPV6
00055 /* The Windows build uses wpcap to connect to a host interface. It finds the interface by scanning for
00056  * an address, which can be specified here and overridden with the command line.
00057  * An ip4 or ip6 address can be used; this allows turning off the ip4 protocol on the interface.
00058  * The existing turorials use an ipv4 address, so we leave that as the default.
00059  * Non-windows builds don't use this define.
00060  */
00061 //#define WPCAP_INTERFACE_ADDRESS    "fdfd::1"  //10.10.10.10 is the default (even for ipv6)
00062 
00063 /* Minimal-net gets a 6 byte ethernet MAC assigned in uip.c, currently {0x00,0x06,0x98,0x00,0x02,0x32}
00064  * This gets converted to a link layer address of [fe80::206:98ff:fe00:232]
00065  * You could change the uip.c address when running multiple instances, however HARD_CODED_ADDRESS
00066  * can also specify a different MAC address if any of the last three bytes are non-zero. It can also
00067  * specify a prefix if any of the first four longs are nonzero. RPL builds use this to pass a prefix
00068  * to the border router and also to ensure it has a different link-layer address from the RPL end node.
00069  * HARD_CODED_ADDRESS can also be changed in /platform/minimal-net/contiki-main.c so as not to force complete
00070  * rebuilds when making multiple instances of a minimal-net client.
00071 */
00072 //#define HARD_CODED_ADDRESS      "::10" //assign link-layer address fe80::ff:fe00:10, wait for RA or RPL prefix
00073 //#define HARD_CODED_ADDRESS      "fdfd::" //assign prefix; address becomes fdfd::206:98ff:fe00:232
00074 //#define HARD_CODED_ADDRESS      "fdfd::10" //assign prefix and ipv6 address fdfd::ff:fe00:10
00075 
00076 /* The status.shtml page shows addresses, neighbors, and routes on ipv6 builds. Use this define to enable
00077  * the needed routines in httpd-cgi.c on the webserver6 build. The status page is present in
00078  * /apps/webserver/httpd-fs/ but not in the default /apps/webserver/httpd-fsdata.c file.
00079  * To include it run the PERL script /../../tools/makefsdata from the /apps/webserver/ directory.
00080  * NB: Webserver builds on all platforms will use the current httpd-fsdata.c file. The added 160 bytes
00081  * could overflow memory on the smaller platforms.
00082  */
00083 #define WEBSERVER_CONF_STATUSPAGE   1
00084 
00085 /* RPL currently works only on Windows. *nix would require converting the tun interface to two pcap tees. */ 
00086 //#define UIP_CONF_IPV6_RPL           0
00087 //#define RPL_BORDER_ROUTER           0
00088 #endif   
00089 
00090 #if UIP_CONF_IPV6_RPL
00091 /* RPL motes use the uip.c link layer address or optionally the harded coded address (but without the prefix!)
00092  * Different instances can be made by changing the link layer portion of HARD_CODED_ADDRESS in contiki-main.c
00093  * Rename them to e.g. webserver6.10, webserver6.11, ...
00094  * They should all attach to a minimal-net rpl border that uses the same primary interface.
00095  * For multihop testing, configure intermediate notes as routers.
00096  */
00097 #define RPL_CONF_ADJUST_LLH_LEN    1
00098 #define HARD_CODED_ADDRESS      "bbbb::10"  //the prefix is ignored for a rpl node
00099 #define UIP_CONF_ROUTER                 0
00100 #define UIP_CONF_ND6_SEND_RA            0
00101 #define UIP_CONF_ND6_REACHABLE_TIME     600000
00102 #define UIP_CONF_ND6_RETRANS_TIMER      10000
00103 
00104 #if RPL_BORDER_ROUTER
00105 /* RPL border router accepts packets from the host through the fallback and directs them to
00106  * the primary interface. Thus the fallback and rpl dag prefix must be the same. The prefix of
00107  * the primary interface does not matter!
00108  * Rename this build to e.g. webrouter. Then on Windows create two loopback interfaces, bbbb:: and fdfd::
00109  * Attach the RPL end nodes to fdfd:: and the webrouter to fdfd:: with bbbb:: as the fallback.
00110  * Direct browser to bbbb::ff:fe00:1/status.html, bbbb::ff:fe00:10/status.html, bbbb::ff:fe00:20/status.html.
00111  * The traffic will go through the bbbb:: interface to the router, then out the fdfd:: interface to the end
00112  * nodes. The end nodes must be explicitly added as neighbors to avoid a blocking NS
00113  * netsh interface ipv6 add neighbor bbbb::ff:fe00:10 33-33-ff-33-44-10 interface=16 (# of the bbbb interface)
00114  * netsh interface ipv6 add neighbor bbbb::ff:fe00:20 33-33-ff-33-44-20 interface=16 (# of the bbbb interface)
00115  *
00116  * Instead of using the fdfd:: loopback it is also possible to attach the border router to another interface,
00117  * e.g. the jackdaw RNDIS <->  repeater. Then RPL will configure on the radio network and the RF motes will
00118  * be reached through bbbb::<mote link layer address>.
00119  * Possibly minimal-net RPL motes could also be added to this interface?
00120  * 
00121  */
00122 #undef UIP_CONF_ROUTER
00123 #define UIP_CONF_ROUTER             1
00124 //#define RPL_CONF_STATS              0
00125 //#define UIP_CONF_BUFFER_SIZE   1300
00126 #undef UIP_FALLBACK_INTERFACE
00127 #define UIP_FALLBACK_INTERFACE rpl_interface
00128 //#define WPCAP_FALLBACK_ADDRESS     "bbbb::1"  //bbbb::1 is the default fallback prefix
00129 #undef HARD_CODED_ADDRESS
00130 #define HARD_CODED_ADDRESS            "bbbb::1" //bbbb::ff:fe00:1 is the RPL border router default
00131 //#define UIP_CONF_ND6_SEND_RA          0
00132 //#define UIP_CONF_ND6_REACHABLE_TIME 600000
00133 //#define UIP_CONF_ND6_RETRANS_TIMER  10000
00134 #endif
00135 
00136 #endif
00137

00140 #define UIP_CONF_BYTE_ORDER           UIP_LITTLE_ENDIAN

00142 #define UIP_CONF_IP_FORWARD           0
00143 #define UIP_CONF_LOGGING              0
00144 #define UIP_CONF_UDP_CHECKSUMS        0

00154 #define UIP_CONF_IPV6_CHECKS          1
00155 #define UIP_CONF_IPV6_REASSEMBLY      1
00156 //#define UIP_CONF_NETIF_MAX_ADDRESSES  5
00157 //#define UIP_CONF_ND6_MAX_PREFIXES     3
00158 //#define UIP_CONF_ND6_MAX_NEIGHBORS    40 
00159 //#define UIP_CONF_ND6_MAX_DEFROUTERS   2
00160 #define UIP_CONF_DS6_NBR_NBU     100
00161 #define UIP_CONF_DS6_DEFRT_NBU   2
00162 #define UIP_CONF_DS6_PREFIX_NBU  5
00163 #define UIP_CONF_DS6_ROUTE_NBU   100
